content: Registration to the summer-school 'Mathematical Methods for High-Dimensional Data' are now open!
Our paper 'The importance of being empty: a spectral approach to Hopfield neural networks with diluted examples' is now publicly available on arXiv.

Our paper 'Fundamental operating regimes, hyper-parameter fine-tuning and glassiness: towards an interpretable replica-theory for trained restricted Boltzmann machines' has been accepted as a poster presentation at StatPhys29.
Our short paper 'Multi-channel pattern reconstruction through L-directional associative memories' is now accessible on arXiv.

Our short paper 'Multi-channel pattern reconstruction through L-directional associative memories' has been selected as poster presentation at the Workshop 'New Frontiers in Associative Memories' at ICLR2025.

Our work 'Fundamental operating regimes, hyper-parameter fine-tuning and glassiness: towards an interpretable replica-theory for trained restricted Boltzmann machines' is now accessible on Journal of Physics A: Mathematical and Theoretical.

Our work 'Fundamental operating regimes, hyper-parameter fine-tuning and glassiness: towards an interpretable replica-theory for trained restricted Boltzmann machines' has been accepted for publication in Journal of Physics A: Mathematical and Theoretical.
On this day, I earned the National Certification for Associated Professor in Mathematical Physics (Abilitazione Scientifica Nazionale per Professore di II Fascia in Fisica Matematica, SC: 01/A4).
A date to remember: John Hopfield and Geoffrey Hinton were awarded with Nobel Prize in Physics on this day for their influential works on neural networks and machine learning!
Our work 'The thermodynamic limit in mean field neural networks' is publicly available on arXiv.
Our work 'Fundamental operating regimes, hyper-parameter fine-tuning and glassiness: towards an interpretable replica-theory for trained restricted Boltzmann machines' is publicly available on arXiv.
Our work 'Regularization, early-stopping and dreaming: a Hopfield-like setup to address generalization and overfitting' has been accepted for publication in Neural Networks.
Our work 'A spectral approach to Hebbian-like neural networks' has been accepted for publication in Applied Mathematics and Computation.
